result.execSummary:
The defendant Donta D Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge are to be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 7/23/38.  Nonpayment penalty shal be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after five (5) years of Initial Confinement.

*****9-17-14 Judge Siefert, Court ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to state that the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program ****
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modificatio prgoram and a parenting program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donta D Smith

records.addlTxt: Per Remittitur dated November 13, 2018, Appeal Nos. 2016AP000650 CRNM (2013CF005783), 2016AP000651 (2014CF000874) and 2016AP000652 CRNM (2014CF000899), IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on August 14, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment and order are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt is relieved of further representation of Smith in this matter. See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32 (3).

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donta D Smith in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Donta D Smith in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./SAB
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 9 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 5 years of initial confinement.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/23/2038; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/23/2038; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Eric M Hailstock in court, defendant Donta D Smith not in court, in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant has a new case. Case rescheduled for SENTENCING on 7/23/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Donta D Smith in court with attorney Eric M Hailstock.  Defendant Donta D Smith in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Donta D Smith not in court, in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 5/14/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-20-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donta D Smith in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Donta D Smith in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee County District Atty. Investigator Carl Buschmann.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Defendant has a lower number case pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for scheduling conference.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lana G. and Brian M. as well as their school, workplace, residence or family.

Defendant Donta D Smith in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Donta D Smith in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
